johan-final-comparison-all

Loading in libaries

Setting up my libraries.

library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)

Importing final comparison's

Iâ€™m importing the final comparison RDS files, so that I can later combine them using rbind.

ali <- read_rds("data-processed/ali-final-comparison.rds")
johan <- read_rds("data-processed/johan-final-comparison.rds")
karina <- read_rds("data-processed/karina-final-comparison.rds")
pearson <- read_rds("data-processed/pearson-final-comparison.rds")

Binding final comparison's

We are flagging any temperature difference greater than or equal to 15 degrees Fahrenheit and 0 degrees Fahrenheit as notable.

final <- rbind(ali, johan, karina, pearson)

unit_flagged <- final |> 
  arrange(temp_diff |> desc()) |> 
  filter(temp_diff >= 15 | temp_diff == 0)

unit_flagged
# A tibble: 390 Ã— 6
   date       unit      unit_temp station_code station_temp temp_diff
   <date>     <chr>         <dbl> <chr>               <dbl>     <dbl>
 1 2023-09-02 Sanchez       887   KELP                   98     789  
 2 2023-08-17 Hilltop        73.9 KGOP                  109      35.1
 3 2023-04-24 Formby         77   KPVW                   46      31  
 4 2023-04-23 Formby         77.2 KPVW                   47      30.2
 5 2023-04-23 Wheeler        76.6 KPVW                   47      29.6
 6 2023-04-23 Wallace        75.6 KSNK                   46      29.6
 7 2023-04-23 Middleton      77.1 KABI                   48      29.1
 8 2023-04-28 Roach          76.6 KCDS                   48      28.6
 9 2023-04-05 Dalhart        77.5 KDHT                   49      28.5
10 2023-04-06 Hobby          80.4 KPWG                   52      28.4
# â„¹ 380 more rows

After looking at the original csv, there is a comma where it seems Sanchez on Sept. 9th, 2023 should be 88.7, not 887. So, the temp_diff should be 9.8.

Iâ€™m importing the created spreadsheet with collected unit information and cleaning the names.

units <- read_csv("data-raw/unit_info_altered.csv")

Cleaning unit_info

Iâ€™m changing the column names to better fit our final comparison list, and selecting only the columns we need.

 unit_info_c <- unit_info |> 
  rename(unit = unit_name) |> 
  select(unit, type, region, established)

unit_info_c
# A tibble: 101 Ã— 4
   unit          type        region established

Joining

Now, letâ€™s join our final comparison data with our new information by unit.

unit_info_join <- unit_flagged |> 
  left_join(unit_info_c, by = "unit") |> 
  select(date, type, region, established, unit, unit_temp, station_code, station_temp, temp_diff)

unit_info_join
# A tibble: 390 Ã— 9
   date       type  region established unit  unit_temp station_code station_temp

Grouping by prison type

Now, we want to group by prison type to see which types of prisons have more flagged days.

type_count <- unit_info_join |> 
  select(date, type, unit, station_code, station_temp, temp_diff) |> 
  group_by(type) |> 
  summarise(number_of_days_over_15 = n()) |> 
  arrange(desc(number_of_days_over_15))

type_count
# A tibble: 8 Ã— 2
  type               number_of_days_over_15
  <chr>                               <int>
1 Prison                                291
2 State Jail                             67
3 Psychiatric                            13
4 Prison/ISF                              7
5 Medical                                 4
6 Private State Jail                      4
7 SAFPF                                   3
8 <NA>                                    1

Grouping by region

Now, we want to group by region to see which regions of prisons have more flagged days.

region_count <- unit_info_join |> 
  select(date, region, unit, station_code, station_temp, temp_diff) |> 
  group_by(region) |> 
  summarise(number_of_days_over_15 = n()) |> 
  arrange(desc(number_of_days_over_15))

region_count
# A tibble: 8 Ã— 2
  region  number_of_days_over_15
  <chr>                    <int>
1 V                          123
2 IV                          71
3 I                           66
4 VI                          60
5 II                          33
6 III                         32
7 Private                      4
8 <NA>                         1

Grouping by age of prison

Now, we want to group by the age of the prison to determine if the buildingâ€™s age is associated with having more flagged days.

age_count <- unit_info_join |> 
  select(date, established, unit, station_code, station_temp, temp_diff) |> 
  group_by(established) |> 
  summarise(number_of_days_over_15 = n()) |> 
  arrange(desc(number_of_days_over_15))

age_count
# A tibble: 24 Ã— 2
   established number_of_days_over_15

Grouping by unit

Now, we want to group by unit to see which units have more flagged days.

unit_count <- unit_info_join |> 
  select(date, region, unit, station_code, station_temp, temp_diff) |> 
  group_by(unit) |> 
  summarise(number_of_days_over_15 = n()) |> 
  arrange(desc(number_of_days_over_15))

unit_count
# A tibble: 54 Ã— 2
   unit     number_of_days_over_15
   <chr>                     <int>
 1 Lynaugh                      31
 2 Clements                     21
 3 Sanchez                      20
 4 Wheeler                      19
 5 Goree                        17
 6 Murray                       17
 7 Daniel                       16
 8 Byrd                         15
 9 Roach                        15
10 Dalhart                      14
# â„¹ 44 more rows

Charts

Finally, we are creating individual charts to visualize the difference between unit and station temperatures.

units <- unique(final$unit)
for (unit_name in units) {
  df <- subset(final, unit == unit_name)
  
p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = date)) +
  geom_line(aes(y = unit_temp, color = "Unit Temp")) +
  geom_line(aes(y = station_temp, color = "Station Temp")) +
  labs(
    title = paste("Temperature Trends for Unit:", unit_name),
    x = "Date",
    y = "Temperature"
  ) +
  ylim(0, 120) +
  theme_minimal()

print(p)
}
